articles.title: Motional puts AI at center of robotaxi reboot as it targets 2026 for driverless service
articles.description: Motional says it will launch a driverless robotaxi service in Las Vegas before the end of 2026.

articles.title: Google removes AI Overviews for certain medical queries
articles.description: This follows an investigation by the Guardian that found Google AI Overviews offering misleading information in response to some health-related queries.

articles.title: Indonesia and Malaysia block Grok over non-consensual, sexualized deepfakes
articles.description: Indonesian officials said Saturday that they are temporarily blocking access to xAI’s chatbot Grok.

articles.title: OpenAI is reportedly asking contractors to upload real work from past jobs
articles.description: An intellectual property lawyer says OpenAI is "putting itself at great risk" with this approach.

articles.title: CES 2026: Everything revealed, from Nvidia’s debuts to AMD’s new chips to Razer’s AI oddities
articles.description: CES 2026 is in full swing in Las Vegas, with the show floor open to the public after a packed couple of days occupied by press conferences from the likes of Nvidia, Sony, and AMD and previews from Sun...

articles.title: How the Sleepbuds maker, Ozlo, is building a platform for sleep data
articles.description: Ozlo Sleepbuds are going to have a big year, with new products, AI features, and more.

articles.title: CES 2026 was all about physical AI and robots, robots, robots
articles.description: After years of chatbots and image generators, AI is finally leaving the screen. At CES 2026, that shift became impossible to ignore. The annual tech showcase in Las Vegas was dominated by physical AI ...

articles.title: CES 2026: Follow live for the best, weirdest, most interesting tech as this robot and AI-heavy event wraps up
articles.description: CES 2026, the annual consumer tech conference held in Las Vegas, is here. And lucky for you, we have TechCrunch editors and reporters on the ground to cover the news, scout out the interesting, weird,...

articles.title: Meta signs deals with three nuclear companies for 6-plus GW of power
articles.description: Two smaller companies, Oklo and TerraPower, along with Vistra, a large energy company, just signed agreements with Meta.

articles.title: X restricts Groks image generation to paying subscribers only after drawing the worlds ire
articles.description: Elon Musk's AI company has restricted Grok's controversial AI image-generation feature to only paying subscribers on X, after the tool invited heated criticism from across the world for letting users ...

articles.title: Google announces a new protocol to facilitate commerce using AI agents
articles.description: Google said that merchants can now offer discounts to users directly in AI mode results

articles.title: Anthropic adds Allianz to growing list of enterprise wins
articles.description: Anthropic announces its first enterprise deal of 2026, which includes building agents for, and giving Claude code to, Allianz.

articles.title: Snowflake announces its intent to buy observability platform Observe
articles.description: Snowflake is bolstering its data stack to make the platform better suited to the sheer volume of data produced by AI agents.

articles.title: Nvidias reportedly asking Chinese customers to pay upfront for its H200 AI chips
articles.description: Nvidia is now requiring its customers in China to pay upfront in full for its H200 AI chips even as approval stateside and from Beijing remains uncertain.

articles.title: Why this VC thinks 2026 will be ‘the year of the consumer’
articles.description: AI adoption in enterprise is stalling as companies don't know where to start. Vanessa Larco of Premise VC thinks 2026 will be the year of the consumer.

articles.title: Governments grapple with the flood of non-consensual nudity on X
articles.description: For the past two weeks, X has been flooded with AI-manipulated nude images, created by the Grok AI chatbot — and governments around the world are promising to take action.

articles.title: Elon Musks lawsuit against OpenAI will face a jury in March
articles.description: District Judge Yvonne Gonzalez Rogers said there was evidence suggesting OpenAI’s leaders made assurances that its original nonprofit structure would be maintained. The case will go to trial in March.
